title: Absolutely desirable and bright 3BD/2.5BTH House for rent
description: Absolutely desirable and bright townhome in Eagle Ridge. Spacious living room with sliders leading to a private backyard with storage shed. Gourmet kitchen featuring newer cabinetry, Corian countertops, stove and stainless steel appliances. New flooring in living, dinning and hallways on the first floor. Upper level includes master suite with a large walk-in closet and an updated en-suite bathroom. 2 additional ample-sized bedrooms, an updated full bath and a balcony completes the 2nd floor. Neutral tones throughout. The pull-down stairs provide access to the floored attic for extra storage plus a newer solar-powered attic fan. Gas heat and gas cooking. Eagle Ridge Community offers a community hall and outdoor pool facilities in the summer, with the owners paying the association fee. Close to the charming historic Newtown Borough with excellent restaurants, retail stores, and the Newtown Theatre in addition to the award-winning Council Rock School District. Easy commute to Philadelphia, Princeton and NYC. Truly a lovely home.

title: Exceptional, lovely 3BD/2.5BTH House for rent
description: Exceptional, lovely, 3-bedroom, 2.5-bath end-unit townhome in the Greens of Doylestown has 2630 sq ft of living space (the largest floor plan in the community) is available. The home has formal living, dining, and family rooms. The home is drenched with natural lights. The main bedroom is very large with two walk-in closets. The master bath features a whirlpool tub and a separate shower. Two additional bedrooms and second bath along with laundry complete the second floor. A one-car attached garage and a partially finished full basement provides additional space. Perfectly located in the acclaimed Blue Ribbon Central Bucks Schools District, this home is minutes away from historic Doylestown cultural district and 2 local SEPTA train stations (Doylestown and Warminster), has easy access to 611, 263, 202, and PA turnpike, and is commutable to Philadelphia, New Jersey, Montgomery, Lehigh and the adjacent counties. The Greens offers a beautifully maintained community conveniently located within walking distance to two shopping centers with supermarket, restaurants, chain stores, as well as a multiplex theater. Homeowner association fee, lawn mowing, trash, and recycling are included in the rent. Tenants must get renter's insurance.

title: Charming Trinity style Home in the Heart of Bella Vista
description: This charming trinity style home in the heart of Philadelphia's vibrant Bella Vista neighborhood is now available for rent. This well kept one bedroom, one bathroom townhome boasts tons of character throughout. Featuring one room per floor with a spacious eat-in kitchen with access through the sliding glass doors to shared outdoor area. Upstairs on the second floor is a full bathroom with tub shower and down the hall is a nicely sized room that can be used as a second bedroom or the living/entertainment area. At the top of the stairs features a skylight, letting in an abundance of natural light in the staircase and the primary bedroom. Other amenities include laundry in the basement, ceiling fans throughout, and closet space in each room. With its convenient location, having easy access to public transportation and a short walk to local shops, restaurants cafes, and all the cultural attractions that Philadelphia is famous for. Don't miss out on this fantastic opportunity to rent in one of Philadelphia's most sought-after areas! Pet(s) 50lbs and less accepted. First, Last & Security due at signing.

Enter Into A Light-filled Living Room With A Large Bow Window, Modern Ceiling Fan And Luxury Vinyl Plank Flooring Which Flows Throughout The Entire First Level. title: Huge 2 Bed, 2 Bath in the Heart of East Kensington
description:
The Bromley Loom House is an exciting new development tucked beside The El in the vibrant neighborhoods of Fishtown and East Kensington. This building has been thoughtfully designed, from the interior of the units to the boutique gym and welcoming entryway.  With the name as a nod to the area's working-class history, this site was once the Looming and Dye House of the John Bromley & Son's Carpet Manufacturing. It offers a variety of spacious units including 1-bedroom, 2-bedroom, and studio options, allowing you to experience quintessential urban living.
The units feature floor-to-ceiling windows that flood the space with natural light and showcase the rich hickory hardwood floors. The modern kitchens come in a range of finishes including black, navy blue, and white, with quartz countertops and fingerprint-resistant black stainless steel Samsung appliances, adding a touch of style. The in-unit stacked washer/dryers, central heating and cooling, and Energy-Star appliances make living easy and convenient.
The building is secured with gated entry points throughout, managed by the ButterflyMx system, ensuring safety and security. A package locker is also available to keep your packages safe while you're out. Two elevators and additional storage in the basement, including bike storage, make it even more convenient. You can access the full gym and yoga space 24 hours a day!
In addition to the residential units, there are two commercial tenants, including Wag Days, a doggy daycare, trainer, and overnight boarder, providing a convenient option for pet owners.
The Bromley Loom House is conveniently located near the Market-Frankford line, making it easy to get to all access points for seamless daily transit. You'll see the modern matte black brick building with patinaed Corten steel gleaming like a beacon above the train, adding a touch of urban sophistication to the drone of new construction facades surrounding it.
Overall, the Bromley Loom House offers a modern and convenient living experience, paying tribute to the neighborhood's rich history while providing all the amenities you need for comfortable living.
Pet fees apply.
Commercial amenities just steps away:

title: 1 Bed 1 Bath - S. Philly Apt Close to Everything!
description:
Available early May, potentially May 1st.
This is a well-maintained 1 bedroom apartment on South Broad Street between Reed and Wharton.  It is in a quiet, non-smoking, mostly owner-occupied building (other units are only 1 bedroom as well).
The apartment is located on the 2nd floor, in one of the quieter spaces in the building, farther from Broad Street's traffic and subway line; the bedroom is in the back of the unit, even farther.
The apartment features bamboo flooring throughout, with the exception of the recently renovated bathroom.  There are high (10 and 11 ft) ceilings in the living room and bedroom and large windows in both, making the space seem considerably larger than the actual footprint of the apartment.
The living/dining room has large and interesting windows, crown molding and a powerful ceiling fan.
The kitchen has an electric stove (4 burners) and garbage disposal.  Both the dishwasher and refrigerator are less than 5 years old.
The bathroom was completely gutted and renovated two years ago, and it now features new subway tiling on the walls, porcelain flooring, a newer shower stall, built in storage, a handheld showerhead, a dual-flush toilet, and updated lighting.
The bedroom is very large and could easily accommodate a king sized bed. There are 2 closets, with additional storage above them.  There is a newer high powered ceiling fan as well.
The unit is heated with radiators very effectively.  This heat is turned on building-wide, usually after the very first frost, meaning that a tenant will have to wait until the first frost to get heat out of those radiators.  A tenant will not receive an individual gas bill for this heat; I simply charge $300 ($25/month) for the entire season.
Heat also comes from the electric, ductless units located high on the walls in both the living room and bedroom.  These units produce both heating and cooling via remote and do not require the use of a window.  They are extremely efficient, quiet and give flexibility not found in a central A/C system.  A tenant can heat or cool one space (like the bedroom at night) without having to simultaneously cool the living room, ultimately saving money and energy.
The hot water heater is less than 3 years old.
While the apartment does not have a washer and dryer in the unit itself, there is FREE use of a washer (pretty new) and a dryer (also newer) in the basement.  BYO detergent only.  Because the building is so small (and some units do have their own washers and dryers), there is a rarely a line for access to these facilities.
The apartment is on 1 of the few blocks of S. Broad Street not requiring a parking permit, and street parking (both sides of Broad and the middle) is usually easy to find.  A tenant would just need to move their vehicle for street cleaning one day a week during the warmer months.
The location of the apartment is hard to beat, especially for South Philly.  It is 1.5 blocks from 2 subway stops and multiple bus lines.  Passyunk Square itself is 2 blocks away.  It is a 9 minute walk to multiple grocery stores (ACME & Sprouts), a 12 minute walk to the Italian Market and less than 15 minutes to the stores and restaurants of East Passyunk, one the best commercial stretches in the city.  The Broad Street Run occurs right outside the building's front doors, and neighbors line the streets to cheer on the participants.  In past years, the Mummers have rehearsed and warmed-up along this stretch of Broad as well.
Rent is $1175 ($1150 rent + $25 for radiator heat).
A tenant would be responsible for first and last months' rent, along with a security deposit (which would NOT have the $25 heat payment).  I provide water, but a tenant covers gas (hot water only, not radiator heat) electric and cable/internet.
There is no application or application fee associated with this apartment.  I'll call a reference you give me, ask to look at a paystub or two, and walk you through the terms of our lease.
Cats permitted with a nominal fee and pet deposit.

title: Spacious and One of the Best Apartment Buildings in Philadelphia!!
description:
The Metropolitan apartments in Center City, Philadelphia stand tall in the center of Philadelphia's historic skyline. Designed by French architect Louis Jallade in the 1920s, this twin-tower apartment building showcases 26 stories of Art Deco elegance and has a prominent history as the former Philadelphia YMCA Armed Forces Building. Before being transformed into the Center City apartment building it is today, The Metropolitan was home to United States servicemen during World War II. Today, The Metropolitan is recognized as one of the best apartment buildings in Philadelphia. You will find a spacious studio, 1-, 2-and 3-bedroom apartment rentals. As well as amenities that include a lounge, gym, basketball court and a rooftop with a gorgeous view of the City Hall and Love Park. The Metropolitan apartments feature original limestone details, terra-cotta tiles, and hand-carved cornices. Fall in love with restored architectural details and contemporary amenities, including renovated kitchens with luxurious personal touches.
117 N 15th #1905

From Philadelphia airport I-95N: Take I-95N to 676 W (Exit 22) on the left. Keep to right onto Callowhill St. (exit). Turn right onto N. Fifth Street. Continue N. Fifth Street to Thompson Street. Make a right on Thompson Street.
DWELL is on your left-hand side at the corner of 2nd and Thompson Streets.

title: A gorgeous unit that's ready and waiting to be called home!
description:
A gorgeous unit that's ready and waiting to be called home! Located in the heart of Graduate Hospital, enter this fantastic unit and discover the hardwood flooring, recessed lighting, high coffered ceilings with installed speakers, and large energy efficient windows which provide ample natural light. The spacious, open living and dining space offers plenty of room for entertaining friends and family, and showcases the gorgeous kitchen, which includes granite counters and large island, stainless steel appliances, and a beautifully tiled backsplash. Continue past the kitchen to find the beautifully tiled bathroom with tub and shower combo with dual showerheads. The floor also includes a sun drenched bedroom with a walk in closet and access to a large fiberglass deck- just the spot for lounging on those sunny days! Washer and dryer are included in the unit, as well as an installed security and intercom system, and the location can't be beat- close to shops, restaurants, not to mention just minutes away from Center City. Don't wait, see this unit today!

title: Welcome to 325 E Allen St #2! Located on the first floor!!
description:
Welcome to 325 E Allen St #2! Located on the first floor, so carrying groceries and bags is a breeze. This 2 bedroom, 2.5 bath, tri-level condo is available for rent in Fishtown. Enter into the unit to find an expansive open first floor with top-of-the-line amenities, modern kitchen with Carrera style counter tops, stand-alone island with ample seating, and stainless-steel appliances. Floor to ceiling windows in the living and dining room allow for an extra sun-soaked space. Through the sliding glass doors, you'll find an EXTRA-LARGE outdoor space that is RARE in the city and perfect for grilling, entertaining, and pets. Head downstairs to find a laundry room that houses mechanicals and side by side washer and dryer. Continue down the hallway to find your first generously sized bedroom with ample closet space and a three-piece ensuite accented in white subway tile. Head back upstairs to find a hall powder room and a large owners suite with walk-in closet and large spa-like bathroom, with glass enclosed doors, subway tile and an in-shower bench for relaxation! This space is perfect for roommates, as you'll each have extra privacy with your very own bathrooms. This home is walking distance to Frankford Avenue and all Fishtown has to offer. Penn Treaty Park is directly across the street. Street parking is a breeze as no permits are required! This one is hard to beat - schedule your showing today!
325 E Allen St #2
